channel.title: How To Update Whonix
channel.description:
Hi guys I'm sorry if this is a stupid question but I am new to whonix and have the gateway setup with Virtual box had no issues but cant work out how to update. Whonix check shows
Warning: whonix news result: x outdated:installed whonix-gateway-packages-dependencies 1.9-1 is outdated! You should update. You can automaticcally update using whonix's internal updater. Please update using: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrades
Below that also says apt-ger reports that 62 packages can be updated.
So how do I do this internal update I thought it was a case of opening terminal and typing or copy and pasting sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrades like it says but once I put that in it asks for password but doesn't allow me to type in the space what should/can I do?
Thanks in advance

item.title: How To Update Whonix
item.dc:creator: whonixnoob
item.description:
Thanks Patrick would it be easier to download the new version all together and configure with my VM again because I’m having difficulty understanding the upgrade process?

Read full topic

item.title: How To Update Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Password entry:
Just type. No stars *** will be shown, but it will still work.

Usual upgrade:

Whonix

Security Guide

Computer Security Guide for Whonix Linux for Users, Whonix Hardening

For the upgrade from Whonix 10 to Whonix 11 you need special instructions:

Whonix

Upgrading Whonix 10 to Whonix 11

How to Upgrade from Whonix 10.x to Whonix 11.x

Read full topic

item.title: How To Update Whonix
item.dc:creator: whonixnoob
item.description:
Hi guys I’m sorry if this is a stupid question but I am new to whonix and have the gateway setup with Virtual box had no issues but cant work out how to update. Whonix check shows

Warning: whonix news result:
x outdated:installed whonix-gateway-packages-dependencies 1.9-1 is outdated!
You should update. You can automaticcally update using whonix’s internal updater. Please update using: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrades

Below that also says apt-ger reports that 62 packages can be updated.

So how do I do this internal update I thought it was a case of opening terminal and typing or copy and pasting sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrades like it says but once I put that in it asks for password but doesn’t allow me to type in the space what should/can I do?

Thanks in advance
